fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.data.views

Interface IListViewFactory


  • public interface IListViewFactory
    Derives new list view instances from a reference instance. This is primarily used by instances of IListViewStore to restore previously-stored instances of IListView.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be immutable and therefore completely thread-safe.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IListView create(String viewName, IFilter filter, ISort sort, SortedSet<ICell> fetchableCells, SortedSet<ICell> displayableCells, int pageItemCount)
      Creates a named and adapted instance derived from the reference list view.
      IListView getReferenceListView()
      Gets the reference list view, from which created instances are derived.

    • Method Detail

      • getReferenceListView

        IListView getReferenceListView()
        Gets the reference list view, from which created instances are derived.
        Returns:
        the non-null reference instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • create

        IListView create(String viewName,
                 IFilter filter,
                 ISort sort,
                 SortedSet<ICell> fetchableCells,
                 SortedSet<ICell> displayableCells,
                 int pageItemCount)
        Creates a named and adapted instance derived from the reference list view.
        Parameters:
        viewName - the name to apply to the returned instance, as used when storing the instance.
        filter - the new filter definition to use. If null, the reference filter is implied.
        sort - the new sort definition to use. If null, the reference sort is implied.
        fetchableCells - the new set of fetchable cells to use. If null, the reference set is implied. It is of no practical use to specify an empty set. When defined, this must contain all displayable cells.
        displayableCells - the new set of displayable cells to use. If null, the reference set is implied. It is of no practical use to specify an empty set.
        pageItemCount - the number of items per page (defines the list's range relative to a page number, specified when fetching).
        Returns:
        the new instance.
        Since:
        1.0
